bubble.name: Thai Bubble Milk Tea
bubble.description: Thai bubble milk tea, also known as Thai milk tea or cha yen, is a popular and refreshing drink in Thailand and many other parts of the world. It is made with a blend of black tea, sweetened condensed milk, and sugar, which gives it a creamy and sweet taste.

bubble.name: Taiwan Bubble Milk Tea
bubble.description: Taiwan bubble milk tea, also known as boba tea, is a popular and trendy drink that originated in Taiwan in the 1980s. It is made with a base of black tea, green tea, or a combination of both, which is blended with milk and sugar to create a sweet and creamy beverage.

bubble.name: Matcha Bubble Tea
bubble.description: Matcha bubble tea, also known as matcha boba tea or green tea boba, is a popular beverage that combines the flavors of matcha, a finely ground powder made from specially grown green tea leaves, with the chewy texture of tapioca pearls.

bubble.name: Strawberry Bubble Milk Tea
bubble.description: Strawberry bubble milk tea is a popular variation of the classic bubble milk tea that incorporates the sweet and fruity flavor of fresh or artificial strawberries. It typically starts with a base of black or green tea that is mixed with fresh or frozen strawberries, milk, and sweeteners like sugar or honey.

bubble.name: Brown Sugar Milk Tea
bubble.description: Brown sugar milk tea, also known as brown sugar boba milk or tiger milk tea, is a popular Taiwanese beverage that has gained widespread popularity in recent years. It is made by combining brewed tea with milk, brown sugar syrup, and chewy tapioca pearls.
